channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Another year has passed and we still have a very dangerous situation with the broken pipe that pours water onto the path which then spreads across to the other entrance intkbrgenoark. As I said last year, it is WHEN not if someone has a bad fall on the sheet ice, 14th January
item.description:
7030317 from last year gives full details.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Bedroom furniture has been left on the pavement for over 10 days now

item.title: Dumped bikes, 14th January
item.description:
From the pocket park down to Ballast Quay there's at least 20 of these bikes laying everywhere, this is totally unacceptable
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whitworth Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pot hole damaging cars, 14th January
item.description:
Been reported already looks like Sunday or earlier! (Now Tuesday) but still not coned off. Drove into it last night now have very likely flat tyre to fix. Interested how to claim for any costs incurred seeing as nothing been done. I saw another car just up ahead of hole (after damaging my car) pulled over, with hazards on. Also big buses travelling all day through there could be damaging /dangerous as hard to avoid with crossing bollards too in the middle of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 240, Chislehurst Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: One of the lamp post, 14th January
item.description:
The lamp post is not working and a previous case that i raised was closed by the system.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Invicta Road, Blackheath

item.title: Fly tipped bags of soil and rubbish, 14th January
item.description:
People keep dumping stuff in this location. This time it's some bags of soil and rubbish which has burst and are covering the pavement and entrances to people's properties.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Huge pothole on Devonshire road as you approach junction of the BROADWAY, 14th January
item.description:
Huge pothole in Devonshire, it's very hard to avoid when cars are parked on the left side meaning you have no other than to go in it, which I have done on several occasions almost damaging my tyre. The roads in Bexleyheath are in an absolute shocking state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Devonshire Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The cycle lane desperately needs protective wands, 14th January
item.description:
Almost all vehicles driving around this corner cut in to the cycle lane making cycling across this bridge really dangerous. Can wands be installed to protect this cycle lane. This issue was originally added to FixMyStreet in Feb 2023 and was incorrectly closed by Greenwich Council on 14.01.26. This is therefore a duplication of the same issue as it is still unreslved.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sleeper path caused by Ice, 14th January
item.description:
The path is poorly maintained specially during the freezing days of winter mainly on the way out of the North Dock footbridge, towards west india Quay station, causing serious injuries to walkers, and almost every one passing by slept, I personally have count at least 10 people with 3-5 falls.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders fly tipping, 14th January
item.description:
On Nile Terrace, builders repeatedly use this exact spot to dump their rubbish. It’s getting worse instead of better and we are all tired of it as it’s a trip hazard and unhygienic. Please place a camera there this has been going on for years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nile Terrace, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping, 14th January
item.description:
This fly tipping by people on their own street Has already been reported, this is at many trees on the road Would be nice if the council could remove them as the are now been ripped open by animals What next rats Can’t the council investigate who keeps doing this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Titchfield Road, Greater London
